def read_schedule(adhoc=False,):
    '''
    Function reads all the schedules for all files, and processes any new files into standardised, and adds old files into an outstanding files table
    '''
    ### add parameter for adhoc processing - ignore scheduling - 
    ### do we need something that flags modified files? - generate error and requires ad hoc processing? probably more important for case data
    
    ### MAKE SURE THE TABLE FOR OUTSTANDING FILES EXISTS
    outstanding_files_table_json = spark.read.text("abfss://odw-config@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/orchestration/scheduling_outstanding_files_table.json", wholetext=True).first().value
    create_table_from_schema(outstanding_files_table_json, "odw_config_db", "raw_to_std_outstanding_files", "abfss://odw-standardised@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/", "raw_to_std_outstanding_files" )

    ### process outstanding files

    ### LOADS SCHEDULING JSON
    from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
    spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()
    import json
    orchestration_json = spark.read.text("abfss://odw-config@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/orchestration/orchestration_test.json", wholetext=True).first().value
    json_config_dict = json.loads(orchestration_json)
        
    
    ### ITERATE THROUGH ALL JSON
    from datetime import datetime, timedelta
    # from zoneinfo import ZoneInfo tz=ZoneInfo("Europe/London")
    time_now = datetime(2022,11,7) # datetime.now() ### ingested_datetime
    definitions = json_config_dict['definitions']
    for defs in definitions:
        standardised_container = defs['Standardised_Container']
        standardised_table_name = defs['Standardised_Table_Name']
        standardised_path = defs['Standardised_Path']
        standardised_table_loc = defs['Standardised_Table_Definition']
        standardised_table_def_json = spark.read.text(standardised_table_loc, wholetext=True).first().value
        create_table_from_schema(standardised_table_def_json, "odw_standardised_db", standardised_table_name,standardised_container , standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
        
        cronstart = defs['Completion_Frequency_CRON']
        deltadays = defs['Expected_Within_Weekdays'])


        from croniter import croniter
        iter_start = croniter(cronstart, time_now)
        last_start_dt = iter_start.get_prev(datetime) ### expected from
        
        next_end_dt = last_start_dt + timedelta(days=deltadays) ### expected to
    
        ### IS FILE EXPECTED RIGHT NOW?
        # weekdays handling
        # if time_now.weekday() > 1 
        if last_start_dt < time_now < next_end_dt: # always gonna be before midnight
            standardised_table_df = spark.read.format("delta").load(standardised_container+standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
            rows = standardised_table_df.filter((standardised_table_df.expected_from == last_start_dt) &&  (standardised_table_df.expected_to == next_end_dt)).count()
            if rows > 0 :
                print("hello world")

                source_container_path = defs['Source_Container_Path']
                source_folder =  defs['Source_Folder'] + "Source_Frequency_Folder"
                # find correct weekly folder

                # add columns

                if : ### file is available

                ### MOVE FILE INTO ARCHIVE
                ### do this based on the

                pd.read_excel()

                else:
                    ### ADD TO THIS TABLE FOR ANY OUTSTANDING FILES
